name: A Mish-Mash of Hidden Capitals Multiple Choice Quiz | Geography | 10 Questions

questions.text: All I managed to get done while down in the Andes, was to engage in llama racing.
questions.explanation:
Lima.

	AlL I MAnaged to get done while down in the Andes, was to engage in llama racing. Located at the confluence of the Rimac, Lurin, and Chillon rivers, Lima is the largest city as well as the capital of Peru. Lima is home to the National University of San Marcos, which is the oldest continuously operating university in the Americas. Other points of interest in the city include beautiful beaches, colonial churches, and a historic city center that is so unique that it was named a World Heritage Site in 1988.

questions.text: Being human, I laughed out loud when I saw MacArthur wading ashore.
questions.explanation:
Manila.

	Being huMAN, I LAughed out loud when I saw MacArthur wading ashore. The densely populated city of Manila is the heart of the country of the Philippines. The city is home to many elaborate Christian churches, a world-famous Butterfly Pavilion, and a Orchidarium which houses some of the rarest flowers in the world. A vibrant night life makes the city one of the more popular tourist destinations in that part of the world.

questions.text: After giving my girl a rosebud, a pest started eating my toe cheese as if it was hungry.
questions.explanation:
Budapest.

	After giving my girl a roseBUD, A PEST started eating my toe cheese as if it was hungry.  The romantic city of Budapest is one of the most distinctive in Europe. This capital city of Hungary is an architectural treasure trove. Gothic, Baroque, and Neo-Gothic buildings stand tall throughout the city. Visitors often enjoy the local baths and visit the historic Castle District before enjoying dinner at any one of the many four-star restaurants in the city.

questions.text: Remember, lining your eyes with kohl before eating some Black Forest cake is not healthy.
questions.explanation:
Berlin.

	Remember, lining your eyes with kohl before eating some Black Forest cake is not healthy. Now that the infamous wall is gone, Berlin has reclaimed its spot as one of the most popular tourist destinations in Germany. Its temperate weather allows the city to be home to some of the most verdant gardens and parks on the continent. It is home to over 140 foreign embassies, as well as 150 museums. Evenings can be spent at any of the large opera houses before indulging in some of the local cuisine...such as Black Forest cake.

questions.text: After being bit by a pica, I roasted a caterpillar for dinner and shared it with my friend Isis.
questions.explanation:
Cairo.

	After being bit by a piCA, I ROoasted a caterpillar for dinner and shared it with my friend Isis. The ancient city of Cairo, Egypt, is home to a plethora of lovely and unique sites. Located amid the Nile delta, this city is home to the Egyptian Museum as well as the beautiful Tahrir Square. If you are interested in ancient history and antiquities, this city is worthy of a spot in your bucket list.

questions.text: Amber never seems to learn that chocolate and clock making should be done separately.
questions.explanation:
Bern.

	AmBER Never seems to learn that chocolate and clock making should be done separately. Bern, Switzerland, is often ranked as one of the nicest cities in the world and has one of the highest qualities of life for its residents. It is home to beautiful architecture, frequent fairs and film festivals.  Some of the most prominent methods of transportation involve trams, trolleys and funiculars.

questions.text: Dumb Elmo paneled his yacht while cruising around the Caribbean.
questions.explanation:
Belmopan.

	DumB ELMO PANeled his yacht while cruising around the Caribbean. Belmopan is the new capital city of Belize. It was founded after the destruction of the old capital city of Belize City by Hurricane Hattie in 1961. Warm weather predominates this city making it a popular tourist destination all year around. A visit to Belmopan will allow you to see the University of Belize and the Belize Archaeology Museum. While it may lack some of the historical significance of other cities in this quiz, Belmopan gives the visitor a view of modern city planning that attempts to mix the new with the old.

questions.text: Nemo scowled at me when I sat down and ate his stroganoff.
questions.explanation:
Moscow.

	NeMO SCOWled at me when I sat down and ate his stroganoff. The city of Moscow, Russia, is home to many wonderful and unique sites. Established in the 12th century, Moscow has grown into one of the largest cities on the planet. Located on the Moskva River, Moscow is home to large forested areas, Red Square, and the iconic St. Basil's Cathedral. The city is in the midst of a revival that is attempting to save the historical sites as well as help the city move forward. There are many places to go and things to see in this magnificent capital city.

questions.text: While Nero messed with his fiddle, there was a large uncontrolled fire.
questions.explanation:
Rome.

	While NeRO MEssed with his fiddle, there was a large uncontrolled fire. The ancient city of Rome, Italy is surely one of the most picturesque in the world. It is home to many beautiful buildings, plazas, and fountains. This city is home to the Colosseum, Vatican City, and the Tiber River. While this city is over 2,000 years old, there is always something new and exciting to see. After touring the sites above ground, there is always a tour of the catacombs below ground, for those who like a touch of the macabre.

questions.text: I started to quit, only to find out that I had never started to climb into one of the world's highest world capitals.
questions.explanation:
Quito.

	I started to QUIT Only to find out that I had never started to climb into the world's highest capital. The historic city of Quito, Ecuador is so unusual and unique, that it was one of the first locations to be declared a World Cultural Heritage site by UNESCO. This colorful city of one of the best preserved cities in South America. It is home to the 16th century Catholic church known as the Cathedral of Quito, as well as many other Early-American churches and large parks. In the middle of the city is El Panecillo, a large hill that rises almost 10,000 ft. above sea level. It is topped by a large winged statue of the Virgin Mary.
